item.title: [PHP] SESSIONS vs COOKIES
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“SRBuckey5266, post:12, topic:531478”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=650267.msg4368240#msg4368240 date=1380086182]

Sessions are stored on the server, however sessions still use cookies and can be hijacked via XSS.


[/quote]Does that actually show the value of the session though?

Yes.

Well that looks like a hash, can’t do much with that, right?
$_SESSION[‘user’] = sha1($user_id);
e:nvm don’t think that would work

If that was the actual hash that was stored in session cookie right now, you could easily edit your current session to mine. You’d be able to hijack my session and visit this site as me, without actually having to login.[/quote]
Woah, scared me for a second. What I meant by value was the actual value of the session (like showing that the session user_id = 2)

Strucker:

i dont understand anything here, mind explaining what the heck is goin on

Sure. A session is PHP’s way of carrying variables from page to page, and it does this using the browser’s memory, since PHP can’t actually remember variables after load. So I can tell a browser a user is logged in via a session variable, go to a different page on my site, and the browser will tell that next page that the user is logged in. We’re talking about how secure it is.

item.title: [PHP] SESSIONS vs COOKIES
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“runeite51, post:5, topic:531478”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=650267.msg4366949#msg4366949 date=1379860458]

use both

No.

If, for this or that reason, you’re using PHP. You’re going to of course want to save sessions. If you don’t know the prime usage of sessions, don’t even try to make something with PHP. Especially something that usually uses sessions. You can use cookies, but only use them for a, “Remember Me” feature. Never store usernames and passwords in the cookies, as they can be retrieved by hackers, if someone was to get into your computer.
[/quote]

What about sessions, can those be hacked too?[/quote]

Mostly anything can be hacked when it comes to websites, you just have to do correct security procedures to protect them. The difficulty of hacking various different things can vary.
